body:
This post is obviously off topic for the guild but it was posted by @CrystalVulpine, who is not affected by the rules because he is the top guildmaster. Isn't keeping the guild on topic and enforcing rules supposed to be his job? The post is still in +foxes, and the mods are doing nothing. Apparently the mods of @CrystalVulpine's guilds enjoy special treatment and are free to break guild rules, but everyone else's post is kicked if it even slightly violates the rules. Giving special treatment to subreddit moderators is one of the things that killed Reddit, and this is literally the same.

Ruqqus is now Reddit.

**EDIT: boycott +foxes and join +foxes2!**

title: @CrystalVulpine abuses guildmaster tools and breaks his own guild's rules without consequences

guild.description:
Here we go again...

![](https://i.ruqqus.com/post/66iv/ee_ubwXLfNg)

*Cabal*: n. the contrived schemes of a group of persons secretly united in a plot - also: a group engaged in such schemes.

*Powermod*: n. [short for power moderator] a person of power, usually a moderator on a structured website, that takes too many unpopulist stances

This guild is dedicated to whistleblowing and preventing powermods and the forming of a powermod oligarchy which would censor opinions and lead Ruqqus into the same corruption that is killing Reddit.

This post is obviously off topic for the guild but it was posted by @CrystalVulpine, who is not affected by the rules because he is the top guildmaster. Isn't keeping the guild on topic and enforcing rules supposed to be his job? The post is still in +foxes, and the mods are doing nothing. Apparently the mods of @CrystalVulpine's guilds enjoy special treatment and are free to break guild rules, but everyone else's post is kicked if it even slightly violates the rules. Giving special treatment to subreddit moderators is one of the things that killed Reddit, and this is literally the same.

Ruqqus is now Reddit.

EDIT: boycott +foxes and join +Foxes2!
